001package imagingbook.lib.ij;
002
003import java.util.Arrays;
004
005import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
006
007/**
008 * An extension to ImageJ's {@link GenericDialog} class which adds
009 * simplified choice menus defined by enum types.
010 * Submitted for inclusion in ImageJ.
011 * Usage example:
012 * <pre>
013 * import ij.IJ;
014 * import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
015 * import imagingbook.lib.ij.GenericDialogPlus;
016 * 
017 * public class GenericDialogWithEnums_Example implements PlugIn {
018 * 
019 *      private enum MyEnum {
020 *              Alpha, Beta, Gamma;
021 *      }
022 *
023 *      public void run(String arg) {
024 *              GenericDialogPlus gd = new GenericDialogPlus("Testing enums");
025 *              gd.addEnumChoice("Choose from here", MyEnum.Beta);
026 *              gd.showDialog();
027 *              if (gd.wasCanceled())
028 *                      return;
029 *              MyEnum m = gd.getNextEnumChoice(MyEnum.class);
030 *              IJ.log("Your choice was " + m);
031 *      }
032 * }
033 * </pre>
034 * 
035 * @author WB
036 * @version 2020/10/11
037 */
038public class GenericDialogPlus extends GenericDialog {
039        private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
040        
041        public GenericDialogPlus(String title) {
042                super(title);
043        }
044        
045        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
046        
047        /**
048         * Adds a sequence of choices to the dialog with menu items taken from the given 
049         * <code>enum</code> class. Calls the original
050         * {@link GenericDialog#addChoice(String, String[], String)} method.
051         * Note that the menu items are retrieved from from the defaultItem's
052         * enum type.
053         * 
054         * @param <E> the enum type containing the items to chose from
055         * @param label the label shown on top of the dialog window
056         * @param defaultItem the menu item initially selected
057         */
058        public <E extends Enum<E>> void addEnumChoice(String label, Enum<E> defaultItem) {
059                Class<E> clazz = defaultItem.getDeclaringClass();       
060                String[] items = 
061                                Arrays.stream(clazz.getEnumConstants()).map(Enum::name).toArray(String[]::new);
062                this.addChoice(label, items, defaultItem.name());
063        }
064        
065        /**
066         * Returns the selected item in the next enum choice menu.
067         * Note that 'enumClass' must be supplied since there is no other way to infer 
068         * the proper enum type.
069         * 
070         * @param <E> the enum type
071         * @param enumClass the enum type
072         * @return the selected item
073         */
074        public <E extends Enum<E>> E getNextEnumChoice(Class<E> enumClass) {
075                String choiceString = this.getNextChoice();
076                return Enum.valueOf(enumClass, choiceString);
077        }
078}
079
